intro: Cissampelos parriera, commonly known as the African moon vine, is a climbing herbaceous plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Menispermaceae and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant produces small, round berries that are typically green when immature and turn red when ripe. It is often found growing in moist, shaded areas such as forest understories. Cissampelos parriera is valued for its ornamental appeal and has traditional medicinal uses in some African cultures.
